Member Data Documentation

const u8 XHwIcap_ClbFf::ASYNC[1]

Puts XQ and YQ in asynchronous set/reset mode

const u8 XHwIcap_ClbFf::CONTENTS[4][2][1][2]

INIT0, INIT1, ONE, or ZERO. Indexed by the slice basis (0-3). And then indexed by the element (XHI_CLB_XQ or XHI_CLB_YQ). INIT0 and ZERO are equivalent as well as INIT1 and ONE. There are two values there only as to not confuse the values given in FPGA_EDITOR which are INIT0 and INIT1. They both can either initialize or directly set the Register contents (assuming a GRESTORE packet command is used after doing a configuration on a device).

const u8 XHwIcap_ClbFf::FF[1]

Value to put register into FF mode

const u8 XHwIcap_ClbFf::INIT0[1]

CONTENTS values. Value to initialize register CONTENTS to 0

const u8 XHwIcap_ClbFf::INIT1[1]

Value to initialize register CONTENTS to 1

const u8 XHwIcap_ClbFf::LATCH[1]

MODE values. Value to put register into LATCH mode

const u8 XHwIcap_ClbFf::MODE[4][1][2]

LATCH or FF mode. Indexed by slice (0-3) only. It affects both XQ and YQ registers.

const u8 XHwIcap_ClbFf::ONE[1]

Same as INIT1

const u8 XHwIcap_ClbFf::SRHIGH[1]

When SR is asserted register goes to 1-Set

const u8 XHwIcap_ClbFf::SRLOW[1]

SRMODE values. When SR is asserted register goes to 0-Reset

const u8 XHwIcap_ClbFf::SRMODE[4][2][1][2]

SRHIGH or SRLOW. Indexed by the slice (0-3). And then indexed by the element (XHI_CLB_XQ or XHI_CLB_YQ)

const u8 XHwIcap_ClbFf::SYNC[1]

SYNCMODE values. Puts XQ and YQ in synchronous set/reset mode

const u8 XHwIcap_ClbFf::SYNCMODE[4][1][2]

SYNC or ASYNC mode. Indexed by slice (0-3) only. It affects both XQ and YQ registers.

const u8 XHwIcap_ClbFf::ZERO[1]

Same as INIT0
